Items

B

The Codex Arcanum

Artifact

A mysterious book that is rumored to have extraordinary power. It contains the origin of species, spells and curses of devastating nature as well as those of powerful creation. It contains all known runes and those that have been long forgotten. Only a special few can read the book. It has a personality of its own and is temperamental.

Level: 10

Form: A large leather tome. The pages are made from the skin of supernatural creatures and the ink is the same magical ink used in making runes.

Effect: It eases by three steps any task related to occult lore for anyone who can read it.

Only someone versed in reading runes can read the book and cast spells from the book with a successful intellect task. See the Fantastic Cypher Table for spells.

The Book of Origins is semi-sentient and can hide the text from view from anyone it doesn't wish to read it. The book has a strange sense of humor and typically has the translator running in circles or insults the reader. (To read requires Chaos Aura, runic knowledge, to cast spells requires the Rune Caster ability)

Depletion: The book is technically indestructible; anything strong enough to destroy an object of its level merely destroys one of its pages, and the book can't be destroyed as long as at least one page remains.

GM Notes:

  • The book is currently kept in a safe in a club owned by the childe of Il Cane hidden by a cloak of shadow.
  • Elements taken from the DARKEST BOOK(https://callmepartario.github.io/og-csrd/#superhero-artifact-darkest-book (CTS, 158)

D

Druidic Water

Druidic Water can be collected from any natural source of water in which a willow tree drinks.

Level: 3

Form: A clay jug of water

Effect: Druidic Water is used to spiritually clean Moonlit Ash, newborns and used in various other Sussuri rituals.

Depletion: 1 on a 1d20 empties the jug of water

M

Moonlit Ash

Level: 2

Form: A glass vial of ash

Effect: Moonlit ash is made by burning wood in a special runic cauldron under the light of a full moon and then washed with Druidic Water.

The addition of special ingredients into the ash before invoking (drawing) can limit or enhance the runic magic.

  • Blood of a specific person will apply the magic only to that person
  • Silver will limit the effects to therians
  • Oak wood or ash will limit the effects to any type of vampire
  • Sulfur will
  • Salt will limit the effects to marionettes
  • Iron will limit the effects to humans of any variety (including half humans)
  • Copper will limit the effects to Venatori

Moonlit Ash can be used to draw temporary runes on flat horizontal surfaces.

Depletion: 1 on a 1d10 empties the vial of ash

Moonlit Ash Pencil

Level: 3

Form: A pencil with Moonlit Ash for lead,

Effect: The pencil can be used to inscribe runes on any surface. The pencil is made with a hardening process by baking the pencil a fire on the autumnal equinox.

Depletion: 1 on a 1d10 breaks the pencil in half. Roll a 1 on a 1d4 and the pencil is no longer useable.

Runic Ink

Level: 4

Form: A vial of ink

Effect: Runic ink is used to draw a rune. It is imbued with magic.

Depletion: 1 on a 1d10 empties the vial of ink

N

Nepenthe

Addictive: Drug

Level: 1d6

Form: Nepenthe is created from the blood of supernatural beings and consumed in one of several ways see the table below. The process of making nepenthe is known to very few.

Effect: Nepenthe is the only drug that effectively works on all supernatural and human beings. It has various effects on the user depending on how the drug is used. Adding the level to Addiction Stat.

It lasts for the item level number of hours before leaving the hangover effect for 1d4+level hours. While high a single intellect defense roll may be tried at any time in that duration to shake off the effects. If successful the hangover effects start immediately. Hangover effects cannot be shaken off.

Nepenthe is highly addictive. When the hangover is complete a successful might defense must be rolled or the user begins to go through withdrawal symptoms (all tasks are hindered) lasting until the next hit of nepenthe or ten hour rest is taken.

If a full cycle (a successful might defense or a ten hour rest after a hangover) of nepenthe has been completed remove 1 points from the Addiction Stat.

d6 Effect Use Smell Hangover
1 Calm Water/oil diffusion Cotton Candy Initative hindered
2 Ecstasy Straight Diffused Orange Perception hindered
3 Lust Smoked Vanilla Social interactions hindered
4 Fear Consumed Wood Smoke Perception & Initiative hindered
5 Delirium Snorted Chocolate Intellect tasks hindered
6 Near Death Shot up Decay Move down Damage Track

Depletion: 1 use

V

Vampiric Snare

Artifact

Level: 6

Form: A sleek, obsidian amulet with a blood-red gemstone at its center. The gemstone pulses with an eerie glow, casting dancing shadows around the amulet.

Effect: The Vampiric Snare is a powerful artifact designed to ensnare vampires and restrict their abilities. When activated, the amulet emits a low hum, and the gemstone glows brighter. The amulet can be used in two distinct ways:

  1. Vampiric Ward: By holding the amulet and speaking the command word, the user creates an invisible, dome-shaped ward with a 30-foot radius. Vampires attempting to cross the ward must make a Might defense roll with a difficulty of 6 or be repelled, unable to pass through for the duration of the ward (up to 10 minutes). Additionally, vampires within the ward suffer a reduction in their supernatural abilities, such as strength and speed, effectively lowering their level by 3 for the duration.
  2. Vampiric Bind: By focusing their will and spending 1 Intellect point, the user can activate the Vampiric Snare's second power. A ghostly chain extends from the amulet, wrapping around a single vampire within 100 feet. The vampire must make a Might defense roll with a difficulty of 6 or become immobilized and unable to use their supernatural abilities for one minute. The chain dissipates if the vampire leaves the 100-foot range or if they break free with a successful Might roll against the same difficulty.

Depletion: 1 on a 1d6
